intro: Rostellularia tenella, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
